meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Ordonnance nº 92-1068 portant extension et adaptation à la collectivité territoriale de Mayotte de certaines dispositions relatives à la lutte contre la pollution.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Journal officiel de la République française nº 230, 3 octobre 19927, p. 13751 et 13752.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: Cette ordonnance porte extension et adaptation à la collectivité territoriale de Mayotte de certaines dispositions relatives à la lutte contre la pollution. Il s'agit, notamment, des dispositions des articles 1er à 3 et 5 à 7 de la loi nº 61-842 relative à la lutte contre la pollution atmosphérique, d'une série de dispositions de la loi nº 75-633 relative à l'élimination des déchets et à la récupération des matériaux, des dispositions de la loi nº 76-663 relative aux installations classées pour la protection de l'environnement. En matière de gestion et de conservation de l'eau, le représentant du gouvernement assure la conservation, la gestion et la police des eaux superficielles et souterraines sur le territoire de la collectivité territoriale de Mayotte, il exerce les attributions confiées aux autorités administratives par les dispositions mentionnées au premier alinéa de l'article 45 de la loi 92-3 et il peut compléter la réglementation applicable en cette matière en vue de protéger de la pollution les eau

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Arrêté royal relatif aux mesures en matière de commercialisation des animaux d'exploitation en ce qui concerne certaines substances ou résidus de substances pharmacologiquement actives.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Moniteur Belge nº 190, 7 octobre 1997, p. 26283 et 26284.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: La partie initiale contient la définition de certains termes comme, par exemple, "commercialiser", "animaux d'exploitation", "troupeau", etc. L'article 2 établit qu'il est interdit de commercialiser des animaux d'exploitation lorsque ces animaux sont susceptibles de contenir des résidus suite à un traitement illégal. L'arrêté comprend 5 articles.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Arrêté du Gouvernement wallon concernant les aides à l'agriculture.

meta.name: entryIntoForce
meta.content: Le présent arrêté entre en vigueur le jour de sa signature.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Moniteur Belge nº 204, 25 octobre 1997, p. 28449 à 28463.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: Cet arrêté du Gouvernement wallon concernant les aides à l'agriculture est composé par 74 articles répartis en 3 titres: Dispositions communes - Définitions générales (I) - Qualification professionnelle et aptitudes - Aides aux investissements dans les exploitations agricoles - Aides à l'installation des exploitants agricoles - Aides régionales aux investissements relatifs au bien-être des animaux et en faveur de la lutte contre les maladies infectieuses - Mesures régionales en faveur des exploitations en difficultés financières - Aides régionales aux CUMA - Aides aux coopératives de transformation et commercialisation - Aides de démarrage aux groupements; Aides spécifiques aux régions défavorisées (II) - Primes spéciales à l'investissements et à l'installation en régions défavorisées - Indemnités compensatoires - Aides aux groupements fourragers; Dispositions générales et finales (III). Une annexe est jointe à cet arrêté.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Arrêté de l'Exécutif de la Région de Bruxelles-Capitale établissant le classement des eaux de surface.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Moniteur Belge nº 139, 17 juillet 1992, p. 16467 à 16472.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: Cet arrêté s'applique aux eaux ayant besoin d'être protégées ou améliorées pour être aptes à la vie des poissons. Il ne s'applique pas aux eaux se trouvant dans les bassins naturels ou artificiels utilisés pour l'élevage intensif des poissons sous forme de pisciculture. L'article 4 énumère des zones d'eaux cyprinicoles. L'arrêté comprend 9 articles et 1 annexe.

meta.content: Arrêté ministériel portant réglementation en matière de traitement des radiations ionisantes de denrées destinées à l'alimentation humaine ou animale.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: Un arrêté ministériel du 16 juillet 1980 portant réglementation en matière de traitement par des radiations ionisantes de denrées destinées à l'alimentation humaine ou animale porte la consultation des versions antérieures à partir du 1er janvier 1989 et mise à jour au 21 juin 1994. Il est composé par 3 articles et 2 annexes. L'article 1er établit que les seules denrées destinées à l'alimentation humaine ou animale pouvant, en vue de leur mise dans le commerce faire l'objet de traitement par les radiations ionisantes sont celles prévues à l'annexe du présent arrêté et ce aux conditions qui y sont fixées. L'article 2 spécifie que le traitement par des radiations ionisantes de denrées destinées à l'alimentation humaine ou animale autres que celles visées à l'annexe du présent arrêté est autorisé à condition que ces denrées soient péremptoirement destinées à l'exportation vers des pays autorisant leur commercialisation. meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Boletín Oficial del Estado Nº 133, 4 de junio de 1994, págs. 17781-17788.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: La presente Ley consta de 7 capítulos, 31 artículos, 2 disposiciones adicionales y 7 finales. INDICE: Disposiciones generales (I); Utilización confinada de organismos modificados genéticamente (II); Liberación voluntaria de organismos modificados genéticamente con fines de investigación y desarrollo o cualquier otro distinto de la comercialización (III); Comercialización de organismos modificados genéticamente o de productos que los contengan (IV); Información y control (V); Infracciones y sanciones (VI); Competencias administrativas (VII).La presente Ley tiene por objeto el establecimiento del régimen jurídico aplicable a las actividades de utilización confinada, liberación voluntaria de organismos modificados genéticamente y comercialización de estos organismos o de productos que los contengan, con el fin de evitar los eventuales riesgos o reducir los posibles daños que de estas actividades pudieran derivarse para la salud humana o el medio ambiente. meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Agreement between the Republic of Cyprus and the Czech Republic on cooperation in the field of agriculture.

meta.name: entryIntoForce
meta.content: The Agreement enters into force on the day of its signature. It has been concluded for a period of five years and shall be automatically extended for further five years unless one of the Contracting Parties denounces it, six months before its expiration.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Episimi Episimi Efimerida tis Kypriakis Dimokratias No. 3161, Supplement VII, 4 July 1997, pp. 167-176.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: The Ministry of Agriculture, Natural Resources and Environment of the Republic of Cyprus and the Ministry of Agriculture of the Czech Republic have agreed to cooperate in economic, manufacturing, scientific and technological area within the scope of their powers and in virtue of the legal standards of the two contracting States. The cooperation shall be mainly focused on the following: 1) plant protection: plant breeding, seed breeding, seed production, agricultural cultures' cultivating including the use of modern technologies of highly productive plant genetic material, the use of production methods of environmentally clean products and adequate plant protection means; 2) animal production: breeding, cultivation and preening work, use of modern technologies in the breeding of highly productive animals; 3) establishment and operation of efficient agricultural farms; 4) processing and use of agricultural products, organising of the activities of private and state-owned businesses and possibilities for establi

meta.content: Environment and Land Use Act ([RSBC 1996] Chapter 117).

meta.name: publicationReference
meta.content: Revised Statutes and Consolidated Regulations of British Columbia.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: This Act provides for the continued activity of the "Environment and Land Use Committee", a non-remunerated office composed of a chair and other members of the Cabinet appointed by the Lieutenant Governor in Council (LGC). Its duties and powers are listed as follows: (a) establish and recommend programs designed to foster increased public concern and awareness of the environment; (b) ensure that all aspects of preservation and maintenance of the natural environment are fully considered in the administration of land use and resource development commensurate with a maximum beneficial land use, and minimize and prevent waste of those resources, and despoliation of the environment occasioned by that use; (c) make recommendations to the LGC on any matter relating to the environment and the development and use of land and other natural resources; (d) inquire into and study any matter related to the environment or land use; (e) prepare reports and, if advisable, make recommendations to the Lieutenant Governor in Cou

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Farming and Fishing Industries Development Act ([RSBC 1996] Chapter 134).

meta.name: publicationReference
meta.content: Revised Statutes and Consolidated Regulations of British Columbia.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: The purpose of this Act is to provide for the establishment of funds to promote the interests of all producers of commodities, which are defined as "products derived from plants or animals, including parts, products or by-products, and fish or aquatic plants, that are raised or gathered for profit" (sect. 1). Detailed procedures for the setting up and management of such funds are set out in section 2, including the duties and responsibilities of producers of the commodity, the relevant minister and other government representatives, who will form a Council appointed by the minister. From its revenues (levies charged on producers), the Council will be responsible for expenditures for the (i) benefit and promotion of the commodity's industry in British Columbia (ii) conduct of support research or educational programs in British Columbia in respect of the development and promotion of a commodity. The Council must prepare an annual report (sect. 7). The remaining sections deal with audits, annual general meeting,

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Rules for the Manufacture, Use, Import, Export and Storage of Hazardous Micro-organisms Genetically Engineered Organisms or Cells, 1989.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: The Rules aim at the protection of the environment, nature and health, in connection with the application of gene technology and micro-organisms. According to article 2.2, these Rules shall "apply to genetically engineered organisms, micro-organisms and cells and correspondingly to any substances and products and foodstuffs, etc. of which such cells, organisms or tissues hereof form part". The Rules regulate the powers of the following authorities: (a) Recombinant DNA Advisory Committee (RDAC), to review developments in biotechnology at national and international levels and to recommend suitable and appropriate safety regulations; (b) Review Committee on Genetic Manipulation (RCGM), in charge of monitoring the safety related aspect in respect of research projects and activities involving genetically engineered organisms and/or hazardous micro-organisms; (c) Institutional Biosafety Committee (IBSC), which shall assist research institutions, in accordance with the guidelines of the RCGM, in the preparation of a

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: The fundamental provision of this Act is contained in section 5: owners of animals which appear to be diseased are under the obligation to give notice to relevant inspectors and minister, to not dispose of the animal and to keep the animal separate from other animals not diseased until an inspector determines it is free of disease. The Act covers "animals", as prescribed for the purposes of this Act, and "aquatic animals" which are defined as fish, aquatic vertebrates or aquatic invertebrates. "Infectious or contagious disease" means tuberculosis, brucellosis, swine plague, caseous lymphadenitis, equine encephalomyelitis, foot rot in sheep, distemper in fur bears and any disease or endoparasite or ectoparasite that the Lieutenant Governor in Council (LGC) declares to be an infectious or contagious disease for the purpose of this Act." (sect. 1). The Act also sets out powers and duties of inspectors, including quarantine, animal testing and tagging, pasteurization of milk of isolated animals, offences and pena

meta.name: publicationReference
meta.content: Revised Statutes and Consolidated Regulations of British Columbia.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: The central provision of this Act is contained in section 2 which allows the relevant minister to issue licences, on receiving an application together with a fee, for the raising of game (fallow deer, bison and reindeer) for agricultural purposes. The Minister has the power to determine different terms and conditions for each licence, suspend or cancel licences and appoint inspectors for the purposes of this Act. Section 76 of the Wildlife Act (Escape, etc. of captive animal) does not apply to game that escapes from a farm being operated by a person who holds a valid licence issued under this Act, if the licencee recaptures the game within a prescribed period after its escape (sect. 6). The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations specifying regions of BC in which a licence for a specified type of game must not be issued (sect. 8).

meta.name: publicationReference
meta.content: Revised Statutes and Consolidated Regulations of British Columbia.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: This Act gives the power to "regional and district managers" to grant rights over Crown range in the form of grazing licences, grazing permits, temporary grazing permits, hay cutting licences and hay cutting permits (sect. 3). Crown range means land included within the boundaries of a range district as established under this Act, but does not include land that is subject to a lease issued under the Land Act (sect. 1). Procedures for applications and fees are spelled out in sections 10-19. Section 14(1) and 14(2) deal with direct awards of licences or permits. Section 14(3) outlines conditions that may be imposed on such awards. Provisions on the transfer and disposition of licences are under sections 20-24. A regional manager may change conditions applying to a licence or permit at his/her discretion and no damages or compensation may be claimed except as set out in sections 27-29. The remaining provisions concern reporting requirements for grazing, increase of animal unit months or quantity of hay, the power

meta.name: publicationReference
meta.content: Revised Statutes and Consolidated Regulations of British Columbia.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: This Act provides for the continuation of the Provincial Agricultural Land Commission as a government corporation appointed by the Lieutenant Governor in Council (LGC) (sect. 2). Its principal objects and powers are to preserve agricultural land, encourage the establishment and maintenance of farms, assist local government in the preparation of land reserve plans required under this Act, encourage the support of farm use of agricultural land generally. It has the power to designate agricultural land reserves for the above purposes (sect. 11). No compensation shall be paid for land designated as agricultural land reserve (sect. 36). After holding a public hearing, the board of every regional district must by bylaw adopt a land reserve plan and file it with the Commission who may recommend amendments. If not, the Commission will substitute its own plan, to be approved by the LGC (sect. 12). landowners aggrieved by decisions on reserve land may apply to the Commission in accordance with section 33 (sect. 15). meta.name: publicationReference
meta.content: Revised Statutes and Consolidated Regulations of British Columbia.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: The preamble to this basic Law on management and protection of forest resources recalls the principle of sustainable use of forests for future generations. It is divided into 11 Parts, in turn subdivided into divisions as follows. Definitions (1); Strategic planning, objectives and standards (2); Operational planning requirements for Government and for forest and range tenure agreements (3): Content of operational plans (div. 1), Operational planning requirements (div. 2), Exemption from operational planning requirements (div. 3), Amendment and replacement of operational plans (div. 4), Notice and evaluation of operational plans (div. 5); Forest practices specific to forest and range tenure agreements and the Government (4): General (div. 1), Road design, construction, maintenance, use and de-activation (div. 2), Timber harvesting (div. 3), Silviculture (div. 4), Range (div. 5); Protection of forest resources in general (5): Definitions (div. 1), Fire use prevention (div. 2), Fire control and suppression (div

meta.name: publicationReference
meta.content: Revised Statutes and Consolidated Regulations of British Columbia.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: This Act regulates the keeping of fur farms which are defined as places in which "two or more fur bearing animals are kept in captivity". Fur bearing animals include all wild animals kept in captivity and used for commercial purposes, except those animals excluded by regulation (sect. 1). The Act prescribes licence terms, inspection procedures, offences and penalties.

meta.name: publicationReference
meta.content: Revised Statutes and Consolidated Regulations of British Columbia.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: This Act creates a framework for the designation and management of Crown land as park land or recreation areas. In such areas, the Minister must administer the following: government rights, property and interests, wildlife and its habitats, preservation, development use, etc. of these areas and their natural resources; the regulation and control of public and private use or exploitation of these areas and their resources, and of human activity and conduct (sect. 3). It provides for "park use permits" and "resource use permits", i.e. licences authorising an activity, or the occupancy, use, development, exploitation or extraction of a natural resource on or in a park or in a recreation area (sect. 9). Parks and recreational areas are to be classified according to section 5 (Class A, B or C Park, recreation area, nature conservancy area) and divided into categories according to their main purpose (preservation of its atmosphere, environment or ecology; specific features of scientific, historic or scenic nature;

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Commissioner on Resources and Environment Act ([RSBC 1996] Chapter 59).

meta.name: publicationReference
meta.content: Revised Statutes and Consolidated Regulations of British Columbia.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: This Act provides for the creation of a Commissioner on Resources and Environment responsible before the Cabinet (Executive Council) and who's role is fundamentally to advise on and develop a strategy for land use and related resource and environmental issues and on the need for legislation, policies and practices respecting these issues. The Commissioner also has coordination and monitoring duties and must take the interests of individuals, groups and Aboriginal peoples into account (sects. 3 and 4). The remainder of the Act deals with terms and conditions of his/her employment, hearings, delegation of powers, annual reporting and offences.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Règlement grand-ducal instituant un régime d'aides favorisant les méthodes de production agricole compatibles avec les exigences de la protection de l'environnement et de l'entretien de l'espace naturel.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Journal officiel du Grand-Duché de Luxembourg A-nº 83, 31 octobre 1997, p. 2532 à 2544.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: Avec ce règlement il est institué un ensemble de régimes d'aides visant à encourager l'introduction ou le maintien de méthodes de production agricole compatibles avec les exigences de la protection de l'environnement et de l'entretien de l'espace naturel. Le règlement comprend 52 articles divisés en 14 chapitres: Agriculture biologique (I); Diminution de la charge du bétail ovin et bovin (II); Extensification de la production agricole (III); Aménagement des bordures des champs (IV); Entretient et protection des cours d'eau et des étangs (V); Entretient des haies (VI); Entretien des vergers traditionnels (VII); Programme en faveur des prairies mésophiles, humide et sèches (VIII); Retrait à long terme (IX); Conservation de races locales menacées (X); Lutte biologique contre le ver de la grappe (XI); Régime d'aide pour la région dénommée "Kiischpelt" (XII); Régimes d'aide pour la région dénommé "Lac de la Haute-Sure" (XIII); Demandes et mesures d'exécution (XIV). Trois annexes sont jointes à ce règlement.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Decree No. 24 of 1995 of the Ministry of Agriculture on plant protection and soil conservation stations.

meta.name: relatedWebSite
meta.content: Jurix Collection of Hungarian Rules of Law, WWW, Hungary.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: Plant protection and soil conservation stations are part of the national administration. They are established in each county and in the capital and are supervised by the Minister of Agriculture through a specialized division of the Ministry. They carry out all the duties regarding plant protection, plant health and soil conservation specified in special provisions. As part public, part private structures they can establish enterprises. They are governed by the Minister who gives orders directly to the stations on matters of national relevance: restrictions, quarantine actions for plant protection, plant health and soil conservation. Article 5 lists the officers of the stations. The stations have first-level jurisdiction. Appeals may be lodged against decisions of the stations.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Règlement ministériel relatif aux règles sanitaires régissant la production et la mise sur le marché des produits de la pêche.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Journal officiel du Grand-Duché de Luxembourg A-nº 84, 4 novembre 1997, p. 2558 à 2568.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: L'article 1er établit que l'annexe du 18 janvier 1993 fixant les règles sanitaires régissant la production et la mise sur le marché des produits de la pêche est abrogée et remplacée par l'annexe du présent règlement. Le règlement comprend 2 articles et 1 annexe formée par 8 chapitres comme suit: Conditions applicable aux navires-usines (I); Conditions pendant et après débarquement (II); Conditions générales pour les établissements à terre (III); Conditions spéciales pour la manipulation des produits de la pêche dans les établissements à terre (IV); Contrôle sanitaire et surveillance des conditions de production (V); Emballage (VI); Identification (VII); Entreposage et transport (VIII).

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Great Lakes Fish and Wildife Tissue Bank Act (P.L. 102-440).

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: The Secretary of the Interior, acting through the Director of the United States Fish and Wildlife Service, shall coordinate existing facilities for the storage, preparation, examination, and archiving of tissues from selected Great Lakes fish and wildlife, which shall be known as the "Great Lakes Fish and Wildlife Tissue Bank". The Secretary shall keep a database, which shall provide an effective means for tracking and assessing relevant reference data on Great lakes fish and wildlife. (5 sections)

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Joint Decree No. 73 of 1997 of the Ministries of Agriculture and of Environmental Protection and Country-planning on protected fish species and other aquatic animals, and on closed seasons of some fish species.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Collection of Hungarian Rules of Law in Force.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: In fishing areas the catch of protected species listed in Annex 1 is prohibited through all the year. Some species cannot be catched in the closed seasons specified in Annex 2. Closed seasons may be modified annually by the fisheries authority. In certain cases these prohibitions may be lifted by the nature conservation authority. Accidentally catched organisms must be put back in their habitat.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: National Contaminated Sediment Assessment and Management Act (P.L. 102-580 - Title V).

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Public Law 102-580, 31 October 1992, pp. 4864-4871.; Public Laws in the 102nd Congress, WWW, USA.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: There is established a National Contaminated Sediment Task Force. The task force shall review reports on aquatic sediment quality and make recommendations to prevent aquatic sediment contamination and to control sources of such contamination (sect. 502). The Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency shall conduct a comprehensive national survey of data regarding aquatic sediment quality in the United States (sect. 503). Parts of the Marine Protection, Research, and Sanctuaries Act of 1972 are amended.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Décret nº 97-1133 relatif à l'épandage des boues issues du traitement des eaux usées.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Journal officiel de la République française nº 286, 10 décembre 1997, p. 17822 à 17825.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: Ce décret définit les conditions dans lesquelles sont épandus sur les sols agricoles, forestiers ou en voie de reconstitution ou de revégétalisation les sédiments résiduaires des installations de traitement ou de prétraitement biologique, physique ou physico-chimiques des eaux usées, dénommés "boues". En principe général, la nature, les caractéristiques et les quantités de boues épandues ainsi que leur utilisation doivent être telles que leur usage et leur manipulation ne portent pas atteinte à la santé des hommes et des animaux, à l'état phytosanitaire des cultures, à la qualité des sols et des milieux aquatiques. Elles doivent, en outre, présenter un intérêt pour les sols ou pour la nutrition des cultures et des plantations. Afin de vérifier la compatibilité des opérations d'épandage aux objectifs et aux conditions susmentionnés, tout épandage est subordonné à une étude préalable et les producteurs de boues doivent mettre en place un dispositif de surveillance de la qualité des boues et des épandages. Les a

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: An Act for the recognition of the United Auburn Indian Community in California, for the restoration of rights of this tribe, and for the economic development of the tribe. Section 204 provides for the transfer of lands for the benefit of the tribe to be held in trust by the Secretary of the Interior. Nothing in this Act shall expand, reduce, or affect in any manner any hunting, fishing, trapping, gathering, or water right of the tribe or its members (sect. 202). The Secretary of the Interior shall enter into negotiations with the governing body of the tribe with respect to establishing a plan for economic development for the tribe (sect. 203). (9 sections)

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Yakima River Basin Water Enhancement Project (P.L. 103-434; Title XII)

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: The purpose of this Title is to protect, mitigate, and enhance fish and wildlife through improved water management, to improve reliability of water supply for irrigation, to authorize a Yakima River basin water conservation program and to provide for the implementation by the Yakama Indian Nation at its sole discretion of water management projects. The conservation programme, consisting of four phases, shall be established by the Secretary of the Interior in consultation with several interested parties. To participate in the conservation programme, an entity must submit a proposed water conservation plan to the Secretary (sect. 1203). Section 1207 provides for measures of enhancement of water supplies for Yakima basin tributaries. (12 sections)

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Joint Decree No. 56 of 1997 of the Ministries of Agriculture, of Industry and Commerce and of Social Welfare, concerning the conditions and method of destruction of foodstuff.

meta.name: entryIntoForce
meta.content: The latest consolidated version of the Decree entered into force on 1 August 2013.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: Deteriorated raw or processed food, ingredients and additives shall be destroyed, according to the provisions of this Decree, by incineration, disposal in waste disposal sites or, if a liquid waste, by treating it in a waste water treatment plant. Special provisions shall be applied to harmful wastes. Destruction shall be carried out or commissioned to a third person by the producer, distributor or owner of the product. All costs of storage, transport, guarding and destruction are owed by the owner of the seized good.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Decree No. 5 of 1997 of the Ministry of Agriculture on the regulation of the production cycle of cow milk.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Collection of Hungarian Rules of Law in Force.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: This Decree determines, in accordance with EC regulations, the annual quotas of cow milk production. Quotas shall be published in the annex of the Decree until 30 September each year. Monitoring compliance is carried out by the Milk Board. Increase or decrease of individual quotas shall be proportional with general changes. Quotas may be allocated only to Board members. All changes in quota ownership shall be reported to and authorized by the Board. Milk producers may process the milk themselves or shall stipulate a contract with a processing plant. Where a producer can not place his milk on the market, guaranteed minimum prices and the buying up of milk are foreseen. Application for buying up shall be organized by the Ministry. Conditions of application and production restrictions are governed by an agreement stipulated between the Ministry and the Board.

meta.content: Décret nº 97-197 relatif aux prêts spéciaux d'élevage prévus dans les articles 347-1 à 347-7 du titre IV du livre III du Code rural.

meta.name: publicationReference
meta.content: Le texte intégral du code rural, mis à jour, se trouve au site internet suivant: www.legifrance.gouv.fr

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Journal officiel de la République française nº 55, 6 mars 1997, p. 3587.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: Ce décret modifie le texte de l'article R.347-2 du Code rural relatif aux prêts spéciaux d'élevage. Ces aides sont accordées aux personnes morales dont l'objet est exclusivement agricole et dont plus de 50 pourcent du capital social est détenu par des exploitants agricoles à titre principal. A cette fin les noms des associés doivent être notifiés au préfet du département dans lequel est situé le siège de l'exploitation. Peuvent aussi bénéficier de ces prêts les propriétaires de biens fonciers à usage agricole ayant donné à bail leur exploitation, selon les statuts du fermage, à un exploitant agricole principal. Le nouveau texte de l'article 347-7bis indique les cas dans lesquels l'octroi de la bonification doit être suspendu ou interrompu.

Il comprend 17 articles, répartis en 4 chapitres et portant les contrôles à l'origine (II), les contrôles à destination (III), les sanctions des contrôles (III), et 2 annexes portant, respectivement, la réglementation communautaire applicable aux produits d'origine animale faisant l'objet d'échange (I) et le modèle de la déclaration d'activité en tant que destinataire de produits d'origine animale en provenance d'un autre Etat membre de la Communauté européenne. meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Fisheries (Glovers Reef Marine Reserve) Regulations 1996 (S.I. No. 70 of 1996).

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: For the purposes of regulation and control of the Reserve established by Order 38/93, there shall be established four zones within the Reserves: (a) the General Use Zone; (b) the Conservation Zone (b); the Wilderness Zone; and (d) the Seasonal Closure Zone. The General Use Zone shall be open only for fishermen who currently use this Zone. These fishermen shall apply for a licence. Use of certain gear is not permitted in the Zone (reg. 4). There shall be only "non extractive recreational activities" in the Conservation Zone. In this Zone only residents of the Reef area who have special licences shall be allowed to fish for subsistence only. Sport fishing shall be conducted only on a catch-and-release basis and requires a licence (reg. 5). In the Wilderness Zone use of motorised boats and any fishing whatsoever is prohibited (reg. 6). Fishing in the Seasonal Closure Zone shall be carried out with a relevant licence issued by the Fisheries Administrator. The Zone shall be closed form the 1st December to the 1st

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Ministerial Decree approving the special plan for the completion and rationalization of the water catchment and purification systems.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Gazzetta Ufficiale della Repubblica Italiana No. 286, 9 December 1997, Ordinary Supplement No. 244, pp. 1-30.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: Based on the assessment of the present environmental degradation caused by the inadequacy of the purification systems, and of the data collected through an official census on the water pollution of the country, the special plan aims at the achievement of the following objectives: (a) identification and implementation of urgent interventions necessary for the protection and sanitation of waters and catchment basins; (b) completion of works already financed; (c) putting into operation of completed works. The Decree establishes criteria and modalities for the elaboration of the plan. It provides for a joint feasibility study to be carried out by Governmental and regional authorities and identifies the following priorities: (a) contaminated rivers; (b) rivers with a high risk of contamination; (c) lakes; (d) lagoons and wetlands; (e) coastal waters; (f) prevention of soil and sub-soil pollution. meta.content: Act amending the Finnish Fishing Zone Act 1974 (No. 1140).

meta.name: entryIntoForce
meta.content: The date of entry into force shall be determined by Order.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: The principal Act establishes a Finnish fishing zone extending eight miles from the outer limits of the territorial sea. These amendments concern the right of Finland to take measures necessary for the conservation of fish resources in the Zone and fishing rights in the Zone. As far as fishing rights are concerned, section 6 of the Fisheries Act and provisions of the common fisheries policy of the European Communities apply. The provisions of the European Communities shall not apply to a specified area bordering the outer limit of the inner territorial waters. (2 sections)

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: This Act concerns the administration of Crown lands, allowing for the granting of Forest Management Licences (or Timber Licences) to a defined series of persons (holders of pulp and paper licences, purchasers of licences at public auctions or by tender, builders and operators of mills for the manufacture of forest products, etc.). Licences may be for all or only certain specified species or products and may have various duration periods. Licencees of one or more timber licences which contain in total more than 100 sq. miles shall submit a forest management plan to the Minister of Natural Resources which will have to be complied with. Fees and charges for licences shall be determined by future regulation. Timber licences are not renewable for more than one year if they pertain to an area larger than that which, in the opinion of the Minister, is sufficient to supply the licencee's reasonable requirements for primary forest products on a sustained yield basis. Licencees are required to submit annual statements

meta.content: Décret nº 96-1134 portant application de la loi portant transfert de compétences aux régions, aux communes et aux communautés rurales, en matière d'environnement et de gestion des ressources naturelles.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Journal officiel de la République du Sénégal nº 5722, 27 décembre 1996, p. 572 à 578.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: En application des dispositions de la loi nº 96-07 du 22 mars 1996 portant transfert des compétences aux régions, aux communes et aux communautés rurales, notamment les articles 5, 28, 29 et 30, ce décret définit les modalités d'exercice des compétences nouvellement dévolues aux communautés locales en matière d'environnement et de gestion des ressources naturelles, ainsi que les mécanismes, procédures et moyens de leur mise en oeuvre. L'objectif final est de doter les collectivités locales d'instruments pouvant leur permettre de promouvoir des politiques de développement durable à partir d'une gestion et d'une exploitation rationnelle des ressources naturelles et de l'environnement. Le décret est formé par 52 articles répartis en 5 titres, à savoir: Dispositions générales (I); Exercice des compétences de la région (II); Exercice des compétences de la commune (III); Exercice des compétences de la communauté rurale (IV); Dispositions finales (V). Le titre I porte définition des termes clés utilisés, définit les

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Ordonnance sur l'agriculture biologique et la désignation des produits végétaux et des denrées alimentaires biologiques (Ordonnance sur l'agriculture biologique).

meta.name: entryIntoForce
meta.content: La présente ordonnance entre en vigueur le 1er janvier 1998.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Recueil officiel des lois fédérales nº 47, 9 décembre 1997, p. 2498 à 2518.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: Cette ordonnance, réglant l'agriculture biologique et la désignation des produits végétaux et des denrées alimentaires biologiques, est composée par 40 articles divisés en 8 chapitres et 2 annexes. L'article 3 établit les principes de la production et de la préparation biologiques. Par exemple, on prend en considération les cycles et processus naturels, l'utilisation de matières auxiliaires et d'ingrédients chimiques de synthèse est évitée, etc. Ensuite, l'ordonnance traite des matières telles que les exigences en matière de production biologique (chap. 2) - Production végétale - Garde d'animaux de rente; Désignation (chap. 3) - Produits non destinés à l'alimentation - Denrées alimentaires - Produits provenant des exploitations en reconversion - Dispositions communes; Produits importés (chap. 4); Procédure de contrôle (chap. 5); Mesures administratives (chap. 6). En outre cette ordonnance modifie aussi l'ordonnance du 24 janvier 1996 sur les contributions écologiques.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Decree No. 89 of 1997 of the Ministry of Agriculture on the production and distribution of seeds.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Collection of Hungarian Rules of Law in Force.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: This Decree applies to the seeds of field crops, horticultural plants, herbs, aromatic plants, essential oil plants, ornamental plants and forest plant varieties, to the seed tuber of potatoes and Jerusalem artichoke. Natural and legal persons as well as commercial entities without legal personality which produce, process, distribute, use, classify and control seeds and seed tubers are subject to this Decree. Inspection is carried out by the Central Agricultural Office, appointed according to the OECD scheme, acting on behalf of the State. Only members of the Seed Council may produce seeds. Seeds must be produced, processed, distributed and used observing the provisions of this Decree and those regarding plant and nature protection in the case of protected species as well as other binding standards. The Decree regulates the authorization of seed imports and exports. Section V deals with the classification of seeds and related inspections, certification of origin, packaging and sampling for analysis purposes.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Bulletin officiel nº 4482, 15 mai 1997, p. 533 à 536.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: Cette loi porte réglementation de l'homologation et du contrôle des produits pesticides à usage agricole. Elle est formée par 23 articles répartis en 4 titres, à savoir: Contrôle des pesticides à usage agricole (I); Exercice des activités d'importation, de fabrication et de commerce des pesticides à usage agricole (II); Dispositions pénales (III); Dispositions transitoires (IV). Tout produit doit être homologué ou, à défaut, être autorisé à la vente. L'homologation d'un pesticide présuppose un examen destiné à vérifier son efficacité et son innocuité; elle est accordée pour une durée de 10 ans. Une autorisation provisoire de vente peut être délivrée en instance d'homologation et cesse d'avoir effet dans un délai de 4 ans. La publicité des produits démunis d'autorisation ou d'homologation est interdite. meta.content: Decree-Law No. 74/90 regulating water quality standards.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Diário da República No. 55/90 (I-A), 7 March 1990, pp. 981-1024.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: This Decree-Law establishes quality criteria and regulation with purposes of protecting, preserving and improving water resources and their different uses. It consists of 57 articles defining different types and uses of waters; listing responsibilities and composition of competent authorities, specifying the water requirements for human consumption, water treatment, aquaculture purposes, abstraction, waste water uses, waterworks, equipment, recreational water, irrigation, etc. Twentynine Annexes are attached to the text, specifying freshwater quality standards for human consumption and aquaculture purposes (including brackish water), methods of analysis, substances contained in waters, water supply for irrigation purposes, maximun residue limit of pesticides, etc.

meta.name: entryIntoForce
meta.content: This Act entered into force on 1 March 1990.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: The scope of this Act is to improve the living standards and the opportunity of earning of reindeer breeders. The Act provides them with the possibility to acquire or to exchange lands which may be used for the purposes indicated in Act 590/69 and in the Act relative to Agricultural Production Units (188/77). The Disposition Plan for the land acquired shall be in accordance with provisions of Act 188/77 relating to such plans, and shall be drawn up in accordance with section 13. The Plan shall be submitted to the District Agricultural Offices. The remainder of the Act provides for various incentive credits and grants for the development of reindeer breeding. Section 31 provides for the limitation of landownership rights. (44 sections)

meta.name: entryIntoForce
meta.content: These Regulations came into force on 1 August 1991.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: This Regulation implements parts of the Reindeer Management Act whose scope is to improve the living standards and the opportunity of earning of reindeer breeders. Chapter 2 concerns the acquisition of land and the use of acquired land in accordance with the Disposition Plan and directions of the District Offices for Rural Activities. Chapter III prescribes certain conditions in relation to loans for the purchase of land. Provisions of Chapter IV specify conditions and terms for loans and grants which may be approved under the Act. Chapter V provides for support of reindeer slaughtering. Premises require approval of the Agricultural Agency. (53 sections)

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Décret nº 97-1329 portant création de la réserve naturelle de l'estuaire de la Seine.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Journal officiel de la République française nº 1, 1er janvier 1998, p. 48 à 51.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: La réserve naturelle de l'estuaire de la Seine, instituée par ce décret, couvre une superficie cadastrée d'environ 1 603 hectares et une superficie non cadastrée de 2 165 hectare. Un comité consultatif est mis en place, sous la présidence du préfet, avec des représentants des collectivités territoriales intéressées, des populations, des administrations et des associations concernées, et des personnalités scientifiques qualifiés. Il émet des avis sur le fonctionnement, la gestion et le contrôle de la réserve. Celle-ci peut être gérée par une fondation, une collectivité locale, une association ou unétablissement publics, moyennant une convention signée par le préfet. Pour assurer la conservation du patrimoinenaturelet de la biodiversité de la réserve, le gestionnaire conçoit et met en oeuvre un plan de gestion écologique, qui s'appuie sur une évaluation scientifique du patrimoine naturel. Tous travaux et activités susceptibles de porter atteinte à la réserve ou à ses ressources sont interdits ou réglementés. Ai

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Decree No. 92 of 1997 of the Ministry of Agriculture on the conservation and utilization of plant genetic materials.

meta.name: relatedWebSite
meta.content: Collection of Hungarian Rules of Law in Force

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: In accordance with Law No. CXXXI of 1996 on the state registration of plant varieties and the production and distribution of seeds and reproductive materials, and with Law No. LXXXI of 1995 publishing the Convention on Biodiversity, this Decree regulates the collection of genetic resources. Gene bank collections owned by natural or legal persons shall be accepted and registered by the Plant Gene Bank Council, and shall be maintained and utilized with the purpose of supporting crop farming, horticulture, forestry and the food industry, and preserving and utilizing biodiversity. The Council is established by this Decree. It shall standardize the methods adopted by gene banks, identify gene resources to be conserved, and decide on special scientific issues concerning the collections. The gene resources of the cultivated dometic plants must be conserved by methods coordinated and standardized by IPGRI. Forest genetic resources shall be conserved in their original habitat (in situ), in forest stands designated as

meta.content: Loi nº 005/97/ADP portant Code de l'environnement au Burkina Faso.

meta.name: entryIntoForce
meta.content: La loi a été promulguée le 17 mars 1997 par décret nº 97-110/PRES.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Journal officiel du Burkina Faso nº 4 spécial, 25 avril 1997, p. 2 à 11.(pdf); UNEP - ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT IN AFRICA COMPENDIUM (Word).

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: Le Code de l'environnement établit les principes fondamentaux destinés à préserver l'environnement et à améliorer le cadre de vie au Burkina Faso. Ces principes sont: la lutte contre la désertification, l'assainissement et l'amélioration du cadre de vie des populations urbaines et rurales, la mise en oeuvre des accords internationaux ratifiés par le Burkina Faso en matière de préservation de l'environnement, la prévention et la gestion des catastrophes. Le Code est formé par 104 articles répartis en 5 titres, à savoir: Dispositions générales (I); Préservation de l'environnement et amélioration du cadre de vie (II); Répression des infractions (III); Dispositions transitoires (IV); Dispositions finales (V). Le Ministère chargé de l'environnement est le garant de la coordination institutionnelle de la qualité de l'environnement au Burkina Faso.Divers outils ont été mis en être pour la préservation de l'environnement, à savoir: un cadre de concertation, d'orientation, de suivi et d'évaluation en vue de l'intégrat

meta.content: Loi nº 006/97/ADP portant Code forestier au Burkina Faso.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Journal officiel du Burkina Faso nº 4, 25 avril 1997, p.11 à 27. (pdf); UNEP - ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT IN AFRICA COMPENDIUM (doc).

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: Ce Code a pour objet de fixer, conformément à la politique forestière nationale, l'ensemble des principes fondamentaux relatifs à la conservation et à la gestion durable des ressources naturelles forestières, fauniques et halieutiques; ressources qui constituent des richesses formant partie intégrante du patrimoine national. La politique nationale est fondée, notamment, sur: la conservation de la diversité biologique, la valorisation des ressources forestières, fauniques et halieutiques pour le développement économique et l'amélioration du cadre de vie, la génération d'emplois et de revenus au profit de la population et la participation et la responsabilisation de la population dans la conception, l'exécution, le suivi et l'évaluation des activités forestières, notamment à travers la gestion décentralisée des ressources naturelles. A ces fins est institué un fonds forestier. Le Code est formé par 272 articles répartis en 5 livres, à savoir: Forêts (I); Faune (II); Pêche et aquaculture (III); Répression des in

meta.name: serialImprint

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: The placing on the market of Community aquaculture animals and aquaculture products either for breeding purposes or human consumption must satisfy general health requirements, set out on the basis of the list of Annex A regarding diseases and susceptible species. Special requirements established in details by Annexes B and C must be met by continental and coastal zones and farms in order to be approved by the Commission.Additional guarantees are required for the placing on the market of live fish and live molluscs (articles 7 and 8), aquaculture products for human consumption (article 9), and live farmed fish - molluscs or crustaceans - not belonging to the susceptible species referred to in Annex A.The imports of aquaculture animals and products from third countries is regulated by Chapter 3. meta.name: abstract

INDICE: Guardia forestal (I); Declaratoria de tierras de uso exclusivo forestal (II); Sistemas de manejo sustentable de los bosques (III); Sistemas de control (IV); Participación comunitaria y de las organizaciones no gubernamentales (V); Protección de manglares (VI); Plan de forestación (VII); Disposiciones finales (VIII).El Decreto dispone que la guardia forestal, que es un cuerpo especializado de vigilancia estatal, tendrá jurisdicción y competencia a nivel nacional para velar por el cumplimiento de la Ley Forestal y normas conexas (art. 1º). Asimismo, dispone que las tierras de uso exclusivo forestal no serán susceptibles de posesión o de tenencia con fines de colonización (art. 10). El presente Decreto define el manejo forestal sustentable como un proceso de aprovechamiento de tierras forestales permanentes para lograr una ordenación definida con respecto a la producción de un flujo continuo de productos y servicios forestales deseados, sin reduci

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Act XXI of 1996 on Regional development and Regional Planning.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: The purpose of this Act is to establish the fundamental objectives and rules of regional development and land use planning, and to define the institutional system therefor. This Act shall apply to the implementation of regional development and land use planning duties on national and regional level, and the provisions of this Act shall apply to natural persons and legal entities, as well as unincorporated organizations participating in or affected by the above activities. This Act determines, in particular, the scope of duties and powers of central public authorities related to regional development and land use planning (the Parliament, the Government, the National Council for Regional Development, the Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development and other ministers), the avtivities and duties of regional agencies for regional development and land use planning (associations of local governments, county governments, county development councils, territorial development councils, regional develpment councils),

meta.name: entryIntoForce
meta.content: This Act enters into force on 1 September 1984.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: The scope of the Act is to improve the living standards and the opportunity of earning of persons involved in agriculture or forestry in specific "skolt" areas in Northern Finland in proximity of the Russian border. Farmers may apply for land or incentives (sect. 5). Provisions of Chapter II deal with the distribution of land and its use. A disposition plan for the land shall be designed by a planning committee, in accordance with section 9 of the Agricultural Units Act (No. 188/77) (sect. 9). Section 10 provides for incentives in the form of loans and grants for acquisition of land and certain farm improvement measures. Section 15 provides for tax exemptions. (23 sections)

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Act to amend the Skolt Area Act.

meta.name: entryIntoForce
meta.content: This Act enters into force on 1 January 1991.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: The amendments concern the disposition plan for land acquired under the principal Act, limitation of land property and tenancy rights, and tax exemptions. The disposition plan shall be designed by the planning committee in accordance with section 19(4) of the Nature-based Activities Act (sect. 9). Section 12 provides for the limitation of rights to transfer land that has been acquired under the Act. A legal act involving the transfer of property or tenancy rights without the permission of Rural Activities District Offices is not valid (sect. 12). Section 53 of the Rural Activities Management Act shall apply in matters of tax exemption applicable to the acquisition of land under the principal Act (sect. 15).

meta.name: entryIntoForce

meta.name: entryIntoForce
meta.content: This Act entered into force on 1 January 1994.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: The Forestry Agency is established within the administration of the Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry. As far as matters of environment protection and nature conservation are concerned, the Agency will report to the Ministry of Environment (sect. 1). The Agency shall in general take all possible measures to protect natural resources and biodiversity and shall in particular carry out all tasks entrusted to it by various laws including the Fisheries Act (286/82), the Act regulating hunting (615/93) and the Water Act (264/61) (sect. 2). The Agency holds in property national reserves and other public areas (sect. 6). The Agency shall be led by a Board of Directors (sect. 11). Section 11 regulates the transfer of rights and obligations from the old Agency to the Agency established under the present Act. (17 sections)

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Act relative to Forestry Centres and the Central Forestry Development Institute.

meta.name: publicationReference
meta.content: Unofficial translation of the Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: The regional forestry centres and the central development institute shall actively protect the biodiversity of forest and supervise the use of forest resources (sect. 1). The number of regional centres and their precise tasks shall be decided by the Council of Ministers (sect. 2). The central institute called "Tapio" shall provide advice to the Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry and other institutions involved in forestry with respect to the economic development of forest resources (sect. 3). Both the central institute and the regional centres shall be subject to supervision by the Ministry (sect. 4). Both kind of institutions shall have a board of directors (sects. 9 and 10). The remaining provisions deal with financing (sect. 11), fees for services (sect. 12), bookkeeping and accounting (sect. 13), the pension fund (sect. 14), inspectors within the organizations (sect. 15), privacy (sect. 16), and entry into force. (17 sections)

meta.name: entryIntoForce
meta.content: Entry into force on the 1 January 1997.

meta.name: publicationReference
meta.content: Unofficial translation of the Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: The Act concerns the sustainable development of forest resources in its widest sense and the conservation of biodiversity (sect. 1).The text consists of 36 sections divided into 7 Chapters: General provisions (I); Felling of trees and regeneration of forests (2); Protection of the biodiversity of forest ecological system (3); Protection forests and protection zones (4); Enforcement and legal consequences (5); Miscellaneous provisions (6); Entry into force and transitional provisions (7).This Act shall apply to the management and utilisation of forests in areas classified as forestry land. It shall not apply to areas protected pursuant to the Nature Protection Act (1096/1996) and various other areas specified in section 2. Section 3 provides for uses of forest land other than forestry. Section 4 provides for regional action plans for forestry to be prepared and carried out by Forestry Centres. Section 5 lays down rules for the cutting of trees in general and section 6 regulates the cutting of trees in "special

meta.name: entryIntoForce
meta.content: Entry into force on the 1 January 1997.

meta.name: publicationReference
meta.content: Unofficial translation of the Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: This Decree implements certain provisions of the Forest Act of 1996. Section 1 defines the contents of the regional forestry action plan that shall be adopted by Forestry Centres pursuant to section 4 of the Act. Section 2 provides a detailed description of measures to be considered as measures that bring about the renewal of forest resources. The Ministry responsible for forestry may make regulations respecting measures for the protection of forest stock in the sense of subsection 5 of section 8 of the Forest Act (sect. 6). Section 7 specifies particularly relevant "living environments" (habitats), a term used in subsection 2 of section 10 of the Act. Section 9 makes further provision for the notification to the Ministry of the use of forest resources. The remaining provisions deal with enforcement by the police force (sect. 10), notification to the Forestry Centres (sect. 11), the time table (sect. 12), further regulation (sect. 13), and entry into force (sect. 14).

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Act concerning the financing of sustainable forestry (No. 1094 of 1996).

meta.name: entryIntoForce
meta.content: Entry into force on the 1 January 1997.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Finlands Forfattningssamling of 1996, No. 1093-1095, pp. 3226-3235.; The english version has been translated for the Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: This Act provides rules for the financing of measures proposed by the recently introduced new Forest Act (1093/96). These measures include: protection of renewable forest resources; protection of biodiversity in the forest ecological system; projects for the conservation of forests; and other measures which support the aims outlined above (sect. 1). Financial support may take the form of a loan at low interest rates or a grant. Projects proposed by private owners of forest land may be financed (sect. 2). Owners who apply for financing shall develop a plan in accordance with section 3. Chapter 2 provides in detail for the financing of measures of reforestation and other measures to protect the stock of renewable resources in forests. "Environment grants" can be requested under provisions of Chapter 3 for measures to protect the biodiversity. Other measures to protect the forest ecological system may be financed under sections 20 and 21 which together make up Chapter 4. Section 22 specifies certain other measur

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Decree relative to Forestry Centres and the Central Forestry Development Institute (No. 93 of 1996).

meta.name: publicationReference
meta.content: Unofficial English translation of the Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: This Regulation implements provisions of the Act which provides for the establishment of various Forestry Centres and a central institute for forest development.The 44 sections are divided into 5 Chapters: Rules relative to the Forestry Centres (1); The Central Forestry Development Institute Tapio (2), Provisions common to the Forestry Centres and the Forestry Development Institute (3); The Inspectorate (4); Entry into force and transitional provisions (5).Section 1 outlines in rather general terms the tasks of the Forestry Centres, whereas section 2 defines the tasks of the Board of Directors. The remaining provisions of Chapter 1 deal with the composition of the Board of Directors, nomination, etc. Provisions of Chapter 2 follow the same pattern and regulate the same matters as those of Chapter 1 for the Development Institute. Common provisions are formulated with respect to such matters as financing (sect. 22), control of means (sect. 24), and bookkeeping and accounting (sects. 25-36).

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Order No. 124/92 establishing sanitary measures to be applied on animals against foot-and-mouth disease.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Diário da República No. 49/92 (I-B), 27 February 1992, pp. 1117-1120.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: This Order, according to Decree-law No. 29/92 of 27 February, establishes sanitary measures to be applied on animals against foot-and-mouth disease. It consists of 34 articles, defining different animal state of health and establishing sanitary measures according to their own state. It provides for animal products, meat, or milk requirements to be placed on the market with sanitary certificate and prohibits the selling of contaminated products. It also prescribes controls to be carried out and sanctions to be applied for offenders.

meta.name: longTitleOfText
meta.content: Ordinance by the Governor on the disposal of animal waste.

meta.name: entryIntoForce
meta.content: The present Ordinance enters into force on 1 January 1998.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Vorarlberger Landesgesetzblatt, Text No. 94, 18 December 1997, pp. 451-457.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: A regional Ordinance to regulate the disposal of animal waste. All waste of animals or animal products unsuitable for human consumption are to be collected by an authorized firm. Said parts must be kept in special containers by slaughterhouses and meat processing plants until collection, which must be carried out in such a way as to avoid the spreading of disease, takes place. The Ordinance consists of 13 articles.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Decree concerning the financing of sustainable forestry (No. 1311 of 1996).

meta.name: publicationReference
meta.content: Unofficial translation of the Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: This Decree implements the Act on the Financing of Sustainable Forestry (1094/1996), which provides rules for the financing of measures proposed by the recently introduced new Forestry Act (1093/96). Section 1 concerns the use of finance in accordance with the action plan for the protection of forest resources and the construction of forest roads. Section 3 outlines the terms and conditions under which the renewal of forest resources can be financed. Section 4 divides the country into various "financial support areas". Other provisions deal, inter alia, with the amount of financial aid (sect. 5), indication of costs which can be financed (sect. 6), repayment of credits (sect. 9), interest rates (sects. 12 and 13), contents of the application form (sect. 17), supervision (sect. 19), and collection of debts by the county councils (sect. 20). (22 sections)

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Arrêté royal déclarant nuisible certains produits d'origine animale présentant des risques au regard des encéphalopathies spongiformes transmissibles.

meta.name: entryIntoForce
meta.content: Le présent arrêté entre en vigueur le 1er février 1998.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: L'article 1er établit que le crâne, ainsi que la cervelle, les yeux, les amygdales et la moelle épinière: de bovins âgés de plus de douze mois; d'ovins et de caprins âgés de plus de douze mois qui présentent une incisise permanente ayant percé la gencive; la rate d'ovins et de caprins sont déclarés nuisibles. Ces produits ne peuvent faire l'objet d'aucun usage, mais doivent être badigeonnés par l'exploitant à l'aide d'une teinture et être détruits. L'arrêté comprend 4 articles.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Arrêté royal instituant un régime de soutien aux producteurs de certaines cultures arables.

meta.name: entryIntoForce
meta.content: Le présent arrêté produit ses effets à partir de la campagne de commercialisation 1997-1998 (récolte 1997).

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Moniteur Belge nº 13, 21 janvier 1998, p. 1364 à 1369.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: Cet arrêté - formé par 12 articles et 2 annexes - institue un régime de soutient aux producteurs de certaines cultures arables. D'abord, sont définis certains termes comme, par exemple, "exploitation", "unité de production", "producteur", "cultures arables", "région agricole", "parcelle de culture", "gel"," gel fixé, etc. L'article 2 établit que pour l'application du présent arrêté, le royaume est divisé, d'une part, en superficies de base regroupant certaines régions agricoles et, d'autre part, en 13 régions de production correspondant aux régions agricoles. Un paiement compensatoire est accordé au producteur en vertu d'un régime général ou d'un régime simplifié. Pour bénéficier du paiement compensatoire, le producteur doit au plus tard pour le 15 mai de chaque campagne, avoir mis en terre la semence conformément aux normes usuelle de la région de production.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Regulation to protect old forests (No. 1115 of 1993).

meta.name: entryIntoForce
meta.content: This Regulation came into force on 1 January 1994.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: In order to protect the biodiversity and natural riches of old forests this Regulation indicates various areas in Finland as nature protection areas in accordance with section 2 of the Nature Protection Act of 1923. It is prohibited to construct roads, catch or kill any vertebrate animals, excavate or otherwise damage the soil, and to damage plants (art. 3). A conservation and management plan shall be approved for each area by the Ministry of Environment (art. 6). Article 7 provides for the incorporation of other areas in nature protection areas. The areas shall be property of the Forestry Agency (art. 10). The Ministry of Environment shall issue further directives to implement the present Regulation and the Land Survey Office shall give directions regarding the delimitation of protection areas. (12 articles)

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Loi nº 91-47/AN-RM relative à la protection de l'environnement et du cadre de vie.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: Cette loi fixe le régime de base en matière d'environnement. Elle comprend 22 articles portant dispositions principales relatives à l'élimination des déchets, à la pollution des eaux et de l'air, à l'émission de bruits. Elle indique les autorités compétentes à rechercher les infractions et fixe les sanctions prévues pour les différentes infractions.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Décret nº 92-2246 fixant les modalités et les conditions d'obtention de l'homologation ou de l'autorisation provisoire de vente des pesticides à usage agricole ainsi que des autorisations de leurs fabrication, importation, formulation, conditionnement, vente et distribution.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Journal officiel de la République tunisienne nº 1, 1-5 janvier 1993, p. 51 à 53.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: En application des articles 16 et 17 de la loi nº 92-72 portant refonte de la législation relative à la protection des végétaux, ce décret fixe les modalités et les conditions d'obtention de l'homologation ou de l'autorisation provisoire de vente des pesticides à usage agricole ainsi que des autorisations pour leur fabrication, importation, formulation, conditionnement, vente et distribution. Il porte aussi toutes les conditions et les normes relatives à l'étiquetage, l'emballage, le stockage, le conditionnement et la manutention des ces pesticides. Les pesticides à usage agricole extrêmement dangereux, dont la liste est fixée par le ministre de l'agriculture après avis de la commission technique prévue à l'article 16 de la loi susvisée nº 92-72, ne peuvent être utilisés que par des "utilisateurs spécialement autorisés" à cet effet.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Loi nº 92-32 portant création de l'agence des ports et des installations de pêche.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Journal officiel de la République tunisienne nº 22, 10-14 avril1992, p. 436.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: Cette loi porte création de l'agence des ports et des installations de pêche, établissement public à caratère industriel et commercial, doté de la personalité morale et de l'autonomie financière, chargé de: l'exploitation, le fonctionnement, l'entretien et le développement des ports de pêche ainsi que des installations qui y sont rattachées; la gestion du domaine public à lui affecté par l'Etat; l'exercice de la police des ports de pêche; la fourniture des services aux embarcations de pêche moyennant contrepartie et la participation à l'étude des projets de construction et d'extension des ports de pêche. L'agence peut accorder à des personnes physiques ou morales des concesions du domaine public portuaire ou des autorisations d'utilisation d'outillage ou de prestation de services, avec obbligation de service public, en vue de la création ou de la gestion d'installations commerciales ou industrielles intéressant l'exploitation de ces ports. Cette loi porte aussi la dissolution du commissariat général à la pêch

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Décret nº 93-210 fixant les conditions et les modalités d'intervention du fonds de dépollution.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Journal officiel de la République tunisienne nº 83, 2 novembre 1993, p. 1858 et 1859.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: Le fonds de dépollution (FODEP), institué par les articles de 35 à 37 de la loi nº 92-122 (loi des finances pour la gestion 1993), a pour objet d'encourager les actions concourant à la protection de l'environnement contre la pollution industrielle par la participation au financement de projets d'installations visant à réduire ou à éliminer la pollution occasionnée par les entreprises industrielles et de projets d'unités de collecte et de recyclage de déchets. Le fonds est géré par l'agence nationale de protection de l'environnement. Le décret institue aussi la commission consultative chargée de l'octroi du concours du FODEP, qui est accordé sous forme de subvention calculée par référence au coût d'investissement initialment agréé sans que son montant dépasse 20 pourcent du coût et servie en trois tranches après constat de l'avancement des travaux établi par l'ANPE. Le décret comprend 16 articles répartis en 4 chapitres: dispositions générales (I); conditions d'éligibilité (II); présentation des dossiers (III)

meta.content: Loi nº 94-86 relative aux circuits de distribution des produits agricoles et de la pêche.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Journal officiel de la République tunisienne nº 58, 26 juillet 1994, p. 1222 à 1225.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: Cette loi porte régime relatif aux marchés de production, aux marchés de gros et aux marchés de distribution au détail des produits agricoles et de la pêche, y compris les points de vente mobiles. Les unités de calibrage et de conditionnement ainsi que les entrepôts de stockage frigorifique sont aussi réputés circuits de distribution au sens de la présente loi. La loi porte définitions et modalités de gestion des marchés de production, de gros, de distribution au détail et des entrepôts frigorifiques. Elle porte aussi création de l'observatoire national de l'approvisionnement et des prix, ayant pour objet de traiter et de suivre les données statistiques et les informations commerciales relatives à la production, au stockage, à la transformation, à la distribution et à la consommation des produits agricoles et de la pêche, dans le but de fournir les données nécessaires en vue de la régulation du marché dans le temps et dans l'espace et le renforcement de la transparence des transactions commerciales. meta.name: abstract
meta.content: This Decree-Law establishes rules on poultry slaugthering, deboning, cutting and marketing. It consists of 5 articles laying down sanitary procedures to be carried out for slaughtering and marketing of poultry species. It defines fresh poultry meat and specifies sanitary requirements for trading such products in national territory.

Regulation 6 provides for the inspection of Inventory. For the purposes of paragraph 24(1)(b) of the Act, each the inventory specified in regulation 7 is a prescribed international inventory of chemicals. Regulation 8 deals with assessment certificates.
